rand-althor.name: Rand al'Thor
aliases: He Who Comes With the Dawn

1.description: Struggling with his identity as the Dragon Reborn. Attempts to distance himself from friends to protect them.

5.description: Leaves his friends behind to pursue his destiny alone. Travels toward Tear and the Stone.

55.description: Claims Callandor from the Stone of Tear, fulfilling prophecy. Reveals himself publicly as the Dragon Reborn.

8.description: Healed of the Shadar Logoth dagger's influence in Tar Valon. Has gaps in memory but newfound luck.

19.description: Given ancient memories by the twisted doorway ter'angreal. Gains battle knowledge of legendary generals.

8.description: His wolf abilities continue to strengthen. Dreams with wolves and has enhanced senses.

17.description: Meets Faile Bashere, daughter of a Saldaean lord. Their relationship is tempestuous from the start.
A young Saldaean noblewoman running away from home. Claims to be a Hunter for the Horn.

23.description: Reveals her real name is Zarine, but prefers to be called Faile. Strong-willed and determined.

6.description: Training in Tar Valon, advancing rapidly in her studies. Traumatized by her experience as damane.

25.description: Learns to enter Tel'aran'rhiod (the World of Dreams) using ter'angreal given by Verin.

6.description: Hunting the Black Ajah with Egwene and Elayne. Her anger allows her to channel incredible amounts of saidar.

11.description: Uses need in Tel'aran'rhiod to track the Black Ajah sisters who fled the Tower.

6.description: Accepted in the White Tower, joining the hunt for Black Ajah. Daughter-Heir of Andor seeking adventure.

25.description: Shows talent for making ter'angreal. Her royal upbringing helps in dealing with nobles.

39.description: A Maiden of the Spear from the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel. Can channel but denies it.

42.description: Assigned to watch Rand by the Wise Ones. Hostile toward him but bound by ji'e'toh.

39.description: Clan chief of the Taardad Aiel. A tall, graying man with calm authority and strategic mind.

34.description: Stone Dog warrior captured in the Stone of Tear. Freed by Perrin, creating obligation.

40.description: Follows Perrin to fulfill his obligation. Becomes loyal companion and cultural guide.

34.description: Maiden of the Spear from the Black Rock sept of the Shaarad Aiel. First-sister to Chiad.
Maiden of the Spear from the Stones River sept of the Goshien Aiel. First-sister to Bain.

8.description: Follows Rand's trail with Lan, trying to guide his development as the Dragon Reborn from a distance.
Continues as Moiraine's Warder, tracking Rand. His feelings for Nynaeve create internal conflict.

17.description: Traveling with Mat and Perrin. His skills as a gleeman hide his past as a court bard and spy.

50.description: High Lord of Tear who has been manipulating events. Actually Be'lal, one of the Forsaken.

55.description: Killed by Moiraine's balefire before he can claim Callandor. His plans unravel completely.

50.description: A High Lord of Tear, vain and ambitious. Commands respect through his noble status.
Another High Lord of Tear, part of the ruling council of the nation.
High Lord of Tear, more reasonable than some of his peers. Cautious about change.
A fat High Lord of Tear, typical of the corrupt nobility.
High Lord of Tear, part of the ruling class that has oppressed channelers.
High Lord of Tear, member of the Stone's ruling council.
High Lord of Tear, traditionalist who opposes change.
High Lord of Tear, part of the traditional power structure.
High Lord of Tear, member of the Stone's council.
High Lord of Tear, traditionalist noble.
High Lord of Tear, part of the ruling oligarchy.
Captain of the Stone's guard, loyal to the High Lords of Tear.

11.description: Gives Egwene ter'angreal that allow entry to Tel'aran'rhiod. Claims it's for studying dreams.

8.description: Green Ajah sister hunting the Black Ajah. Passionate and emotional for an Aes Sedai.
Warder to Alanna Mosvani. Cairhienin man with typical Warder traits.
Warder to Alanna Mosvani. Second Warder bonded to the Green sister.
Brown Ajah sister, part of the group hunting Black Ajah. Scholar and researcher.
Green Ajah sister hunting Black Ajah. Sister to Lady Amalisa of Fal Dara.
Green Ajah sister on the hunt for Black Ajah. Experienced warrior sister.
Brown Ajah sister, twin to Vandene. Ancient scholar with vast knowledge.
Brown Ajah sister, twin to Adeleas. Scholar specializing in ancient texts.

11.description: Secretly supports the hunt for Black Ajah while maintaining her public position as Amyrlin.
Keeper of the Chronicles, working with Siuan to coordinate the hunt for Black Ajah.

6.description: Mistress of Novices in the White Tower. Blue Ajah sister with red hair.
Blue Ajah sister in the White Tower. Part of the inner circle aware of the Black Ajah threat.

11.description: Revealed as Black Ajah leader who fled the Tower with other Darkfriend sisters.
Former Yellow Ajah, now revealed as Black Ajah. Fled the Tower with Liandrin.
Former White Ajah, now revealed as Black Ajah. Part of Liandrin's group.
Former Green Ajah, now revealed as Black Ajah. Fled with Liandrin's circle.

43.description: Black Ajah sister captured in the Stone of Tear. Tries to manipulate her captors with lies.
Black Ajah sister captured in the Stone. Severed from the True Source as punishment.

48.description: Tairen thief-catcher with distinctive conical cap. Skilled tracker and investigator.

loial.name: Loial
aliases: Loial son of Arent son of Halan

17.description: Traveling with Mat and Perrin, documenting their adventures. His Ogier nature makes him valuable.

52.description: One of the Forsaken, most powerful female channeler. Was Selene in disguise, obsessed with Lews Therin.

55.description: Appears in the Stone to face Rand. The eternal enemy of the Dragon throughout ages.

50.description: High Lord of Tear, member of the ruling council. Traditional noble resisting change.
High Lord of Tear, part of the Stone's ruling oligarchy.
High Lady of Tear, beautiful noblewoman involved in court politics.
High Lady of Tear, member of the noble court with significant influence.
Captain of the Defenders of the Stone. Professional soldier loyal to Tear.
Young captain of Tairen forces, eager for glory but inexperienced.
Veteran captain of the Stone's garrison. Experienced military officer.
Young Tairen lord, son of a High Lord. Arrogant and entitled.
Tairen lord, typical of the lesser nobility. Follows High Lords' lead.
Tairen lord with lands outside the city. Concerned about Aiel presence.
Common soldier among the Defenders of the Stone. Typical enlisted man.
Defender of the Stone, veteran soldier with years of service.

39.description: Maiden of the Spear, one of the leaders among the Maidens. White-haired and experienced warrior.
Maiden of the Spear from the Jindo sept. Fierce warrior with red hair.
Maiden of the Spear, tall and strong. One of the Maidens guarding important areas.
Maiden of the Spear, younger warrior learning from the veterans.
Maiden of the Spear, known for her skill with throwing spears.
Maiden of the Spear from the Taardad clan. Experienced warrior with strong opinions.

34.description: Stone Dog warrior, companion to Gaul. Captured with him in the Stone.
Stone Dog warrior captured in the Stone of Tear with Gaul and others.

39.description: Red Shield warrior, member of the elite Aiel society. Disciplined fighter.
Clan chief of the Tomanelle Aiel. Dignified leader of his people.
Clan chief of the Nakai Aiel. Respected leader among the chiefs.
Clan chief of the Reyn Aiel. Tall chief with commanding presence.
Wise One of the Taardad Aiel. One of Rhuarc's wives and powerful dreamwalker.
Ancient Wise One, very old but still sharp. Respected teacher of other Wise Ones.
Wise One of the Jhirad clan. Young and fiery, can channel.

11.description: Lord in Illian, mentioned in reports about strange activities. Controls much influence.

8.description: Red Ajah sister with the Foretelling. Ambitious and believes she knows best for the Tower.
Red Ajah sister, highest among the Red in the Tower. Stern and uncompromising.

6.description: Accepted in the White Tower. Ambitious and somewhat arrogant toward novices.
Accepted in the White Tower. Studious and dedicated to her training.

8.description: Red Ajah sister, cold and efficient. Strong supporter of Red Ajah policies.

11.description: Former Brown Ajah, now revealed as Black Ajah. Fled with Liandrin's circle.
Former Green Ajah, now revealed as Black Ajah. Part of the thirteen who fled.
Former Gray Ajah, now revealed as Black Ajah. Known for her cruelty.
Former Brown Ajah, now revealed as Black Ajah. Scholarly but corrupt.
Former White Ajah, now revealed as Black Ajah. Fled the Tower.
Former Blue Ajah, now revealed as Black Ajah. Skilled in Healing.

52.description: One of the Forsaken, master of Tel'aran'rhiod and subtle manipulation. Works from shadows.

8.description: Wolf spirit in Tel'aran'rhiod. Teaches Perrin about the wolf dream and wolf nature.

22.description: Wolf in Tel'aran'rhiod, part of Hopper's pack. Helps teach Perrin.
Wolf encountered in the wolf dream. Part of the spiritual pack.

6.description: Queen of Andor and mother to Elayne. Concerned about her daughter's training.

8.description: Lord Captain Commander of the Queen's Guards. Veteran soldier and tactician.

6.description: Elayne's childhood nurse, now servant in the royal palace. Full of folk wisdom.

11.description: Lord Gaebril, advisor to Queen Morgase. Actually Rahvin, one of the Forsaken.

17.description: Seeker of the Tuatha'an (Tinkers). Leader of a wagon train following the Way of the Leaf.
Wife of Raen, mother figure among the Tuatha'an. Devoted to the Way of the Leaf.
Young Tuatha'an, grandson of Raen and Ila. Questioning the Way of the Leaf.
Innkeeper of The Queen's Blessing in Caemlyn. Fat, jovial man who helps travelers.
Guard at The Queen's Blessing inn. Tough man who works for Master Gill.

31.description: Illianer ship captain and trader. Commands the river vessel Spray.
Crewman aboard Domon's vessel. Experienced river sailor from Illian.
Crewman on Domon's ship. Untrustworthy and prone to causing trouble.

48.description: Young woman with the gift of seeing images around people. Arrives in Tear.

1.description: Beautiful mysterious woman who appears to Rand. Encourages him to seek power.

25.description: Soul-less assassin of the Shadow. Nearly invisible to human perception.

31.description: Another Gray Man assassin hunting the group. Killed by Lan.

18.description: Innkeeper serving the Shadow, tries to trap the group. Typical of hidden Darkfriends.

21.description: Traveling merchant secretly serving the Shadow. Reports on group's movements.

11.description: Cairhienin lord, cousin to Moiraine. Involved in political schemes and possibly Darkfriend.
Cairhienin lord, more trustworthy than most. Serves House Damodred interests.

31.description: Inquisitor of the Hand of the Light. Secret Darkfriend commanding Whitecloaks.

1.description: Shienaran lord who helped hunt the Horn. Revealed to be a Darkfriend seeking redemption.
Shienaran thief-taker with the ability to smell violence. Loyal to Rand.

39.description: Merchant traveling with Aiel. Actually a Darkfriend spy watching events.
Beautiful woman traveling with Kadere's group. Another Darkfriend spy.
Gleeman traveling with merchants. Actually Asmodean, one of the Forsaken.

13.description: Gambler who plays dice with Mat. One of many who lose money to Mat's incredible luck.
Another gambler frequently beaten by Mat's supernatural luck at dice.

1.description: Former peddler corrupted by Shadar Logoth and the Shadow. Hunting Rand with twisted purpose.

55.description: One of the Forsaken, master of war and destruction. Rules Illian in disguise.
One of the Forsaken, always second to Lews Therin. Consumed by jealousy and hatred.
One of the Forsaken, expert in manipulation and corruption of minds.
One of the Forsaken, hidden in the White Tower itself. Corrupts from within.
One of the Forsaken, expert Healer turned torturer. Master of pain and suffering.

1.description: One of the Forsaken, creator of Trollocs and other Shadowspawn. Destroyed at the Eye.
One of the Forsaken, master of spies and information. Destroyed at the Eye.

48.description: Young woman with the gift of seeing images around people. Arrives in Tear.

1.description: Beautiful mysterious woman who appears to Rand. Encourages him to seek power.

25.description: Soul-less assassin of the Shadow. Nearly invisible to human perception.

22.description: Former Warder who became a wolfbrother. Lives in the wild and speaks with wolves.

31.description: The Black Wind that guards the Ways. Deadly, soul-consuming entity.

1.description: The Dragon, previous incarnation of the champion of the Light. Destroyed in madness.

dark-one.name: The Dark One
aliases: The Great Lord of the Dark

1.description: The ultimate enemy of all creation. Imprisoned outside the Pattern but influence grows.
The source of all creation and Light. Rarely intervenes directly in events.

callandor.name: Callandor
aliases: The Sword That Is Not a Sword
The Sword That Cannot Be Touched

50.description: Powerful sa'angreal in the form of a crystal sword. Prophesied to be claimed by the Dragon Reborn.

6.description: Great city and island, home of the White Tower and Aes Sedai. Center of Power.

30.description: Massive fortress in Tear, said to be impregnable. Contains Callandor in its Heart.

relationships.Prophecy: To fall when Dragon takes it

1.description: Tam al'Thor's sword, now wielded by Rand. Heron-mark blade of finest steel.

19.description: Spear received from the twisted doorway ter'angreal. Has ancient inscriptions.

6.description: Blacksmith's hammer wielded by Perrin as both tool and weapon. Symbol of his craft.

1.description: Legendary horn that calls dead heroes back to fight. Mat is linked to it.

6.description: Cursed dagger from Shadar Logoth that poisoned Mat. Now cleansed and safe.

recaps.1: Rand struggles with his identity as the Dragon Reborn, having nightmares and trying to distance himself from his friends.
recaps.2: The group remains at Fal Dara while Rand grapples with his destiny. Tensions rise as he becomes more isolated.
recaps.3: Rand's behavior becomes increasingly erratic as he fights against accepting his role as the Dragon Reborn.
recaps.4: Political maneuvering continues in Fal Dara as various factions position themselves around the Dragon Reborn.
recaps.5: Rand leaves his friends behind, believing he can face his destiny alone and protect them by staying away.
recaps.6: In Tar Valon, Egwene, Nynaeve, and Elayne learn of the Black Ajah - Aes Sedai who serve the Shadow.
recaps.7: The three women are given a secret mission to hunt the Black Ajah sisters who have fled the White Tower.
recaps.8: Mat is Healed of the Shadar Logoth dagger's influence, but the experience leaves him with gaps in memory.
recaps.9: The Black Ajah hunters begin their pursuit, following clues left by the fleeing Darkfriend Aes Sedai.
recaps.10: Perrin, Mat, and their companions follow Rand's trail, determined to find him despite his wishes.
recaps.11: Nynaeve learns to enter Tel'aran'rhiod (World of Dreams) using ter'angreal provided by Verin Mathwin.
recaps.12: The hunt for Black Ajah leads through various cities as the sisters try to track their quarry.
recaps.13: Mat begins showing unusual luck in gambling and other ventures, a side effect of his healing.
recaps.14: The group faces various dangers on the road as they pursue both Rand and the Black Ajah.
recaps.15: Dreams and the World of Dreams become increasingly important as Egwene learns to navigate Tel'aran'rhiod.
recaps.16: Political tensions rise across the continent as news of the Dragon Reborn spreads.
recaps.17: Perrin meets Zarine Bashere (who calls herself Faile), a young woman claiming to be a Hunter of the Horn.
recaps.18: Faile joins the group despite Perrin's reluctance. Her strong personality clashes with his cautious nature.
recaps.19: Mat enters a twisted doorway ter'angreal and gains ancient memories of battle and military tactics.
recaps.20: The ter'angreal gives Mat knowledge from legendary generals, fundamentally changing his abilities and perspective.
recaps.21: Travel becomes more dangerous as various groups converge on their destinations with conflicting goals.
recaps.22: The hunt intensifies as both groups get closer to their objectives - Rand for one, Black Ajah for the other.
recaps.23: Faile reveals her real name is Zarine, but prefers Faile (meaning Falcon). Her past remains mysterious.
recaps.24: Political intrigue affects the journey as various nations react to the Dragon Reborn's emergence.
recaps.25: Egwene's training in Tel'aran'rhiod advances as she learns to navigate the World of Dreams safely.
recaps.26: The pursuit leads through different regions, each with their own dangers and political complications.
recaps.27: Mat's new memories begin manifesting as tactical knowledge and understanding of ancient battles.
recaps.28: The groups face increasing dangers from both human enemies and creatures of the Shadow.
recaps.29: Dreams and prophecies become more frequent and intense as major events approach.
recaps.30: The hunt for both Rand and the Black Ajah sisters leads toward Tear and the Stone.
recaps.31: Political tensions in Tear rise as the Stone - supposedly impregnable - faces an unprecedented threat.
recaps.32: Various factions converge on Tear, including Aiel who have left the Waste for the first time in generations.
recaps.33: The Stone of Tear becomes the focus of prophecy as events move toward their climax.
recaps.34: Aiel warriors are captured in the Stone, including Gaul, Bain, and Chiad. Perrin helps free Gaul.
recaps.35: The relationship between Perrin and the Aiel begins as cultural differences create both conflict and understanding.
recaps.36: Preparations intensify as various groups prepare for the fulfillment of prophecy in the Stone.
recaps.37: The Stone's defenses are tested as supernatural forces gather around this ancient fortress.
recaps.38: Political maneuvering continues among the High Lords as they face unprecedented challenges to their power.
recaps.39: Aviendha and other Aiel arrive, including clan chief Rhuarc. Their presence changes the dynamics completely.
recaps.40: The Aiel's arrival shocks Tear, as these people were considered myths by most wetlanders.
recaps.41: Cultural exchanges between Aiel and wetlanders reveal vast differences in customs and honor codes.
recaps.42: Aviendha is assigned to watch Rand, though she resents the duty and shows hostility toward him.
recaps.43: Black Ajah sisters Joiya and Amico are captured in the Stone. Interrogation reveals disturbing information.
recaps.44: The captured Black Ajah provide conflicting stories about their plans and the Shadow's intentions.
recaps.45: Tension mounts in the Stone as various factions prepare for the prophesied events to unfold.
recaps.46: The High Lords of Tear face the reality that their world is changing beyond their control.
recaps.47: Ancient prophecies about the Stone being taken begin to manifest as impossible events occur.
recaps.48: Juilin Sandar, a thief-catcher, becomes involved in the complex events surrounding the Stone.
recaps.49: The Stone's legendary impregnability is challenged as the Dragon Reborn approaches his destiny.
recaps.50: High Lord Samon is revealed as Be'lal, one of the Forsaken, who has been manipulating events in Tear.
recaps.51: The Forsaken's plans unfold as the Stone of Tear faces its greatest threat in three thousand years.
recaps.52: Lanfear appears, revealing herself as the mysterious Selene who had been manipulating Rand.
recaps.53: Multiple Forsaken converge on the Stone as the final confrontation approaches.
recaps.54: The Stone's defenses crumble as supernatural forces clash within the ancient fortress.
recaps.55: Rand claims Callandor, the Sword That Is Not a Sword, from the Stone's Heart. Be'lal is destroyed by balefire.
recaps.56: The Stone of Tear falls as prophesied. Rand accepts his role as the Dragon Reborn publicly, changing the world forever.
